alert.note: Alert for Kent; Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 13 at 2:21AM EDT until September 13 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Sussex County in southern Delaware... South central Kent County in central Delaware... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 221 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Smithville to Hebron, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Milford, Seaford, Laurel, Harrington, Bridgeville, Delmar, Sycamore, Blades, Greenwood, Frederica, Houston, Bethel and Farmington. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
